required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Assessment of the Influence of Cleft Repair on Microcirculation of the Palate
clinical_study.official_title: Intraoperative Assessment of the Influence of Cleft Repair on Microcirculation of the Palate

brief_summary.textblock: Investigators aim to evaluate the influence of cleft surgery on the tissue microcirculation of the palate with a non-invasive measurement.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in tissue perfusion (regional tissue oxygen saturation (StO2%)) before and after surgery non-invasively measured
primary_outcome.time_frame: One measurement before surgery, one measurement immediately after surgery
primary_outcome.description: The difference and impact of our routine surgical technique on the tissue perfusion of the palate is measured non-invasively with a probe (regional StO2%). Localized measurement of the microvascular hemoglobin oxygen saturation.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 3 month and 6 month after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: status of wound healing, fistula formation

study_pop.textblock: Patients with orofacial clefts undergoing surgical repair of the deformity.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients with orofacial clefts, who undergo routine cleft repair
Exclusion Criteria:
- missing datasets
- no signed consent for research.

overall_official.last_name: Benito K Benitez, MD DDS MHBA
overall_official.affiliation: University Basel and University Hospital Basel

overall_contact.last_name: Benito K Benitez, MD DDS MHBA

Intraoperative vascular anatomy, arterial blood flow velocity, and microcirculation in unilateral and bilateral cleft lip repair. Plast Reconstr Surg. 2012 Nov;130(5):1120-30. doi: 10.1097/PRS.0b013e318267d4fb.
